sect2.title: Logging In
sect2.para: The main page consists of the welcome text and the login part. Login here with your username and password. Your username is the same from your Bugzilla or &product; account. After you have logged in successfully the main page displays.
From this main page you can reach different sections:

listitem.para: List of All Projects: shows what is named for
Watched Projects: shows all projects that you are interested in
Home Projects: links to your own project page
Build Service Status: if you are interested in what is going on behind the scencs
Statistics: for those with addiction to mathematic

sect2.title: Listing all Projects
sect2.para: After you have successfully logged in, you can reach from the main page the link List of All Projects . It gives you a list of all public projects on the &obs;. Insert a project name to reduce the amount of list entries.

sect2.title: Watching Others Projects
sect2.para: On each project's home page there is a Watch this project link. If you click on this link, a reference is inserted in the list of watched projects.
You can get always a list of your watched projects from the main page by clicking Watched Projects.

sect2.title: Finding Home
sect2.para: One of the most important page is your home project. You can get there from the main page with the click on Home Project. It gives you

listitem.para: a list of categories (not implemented yet.)
and the distribution for whom your packages will be build.

sect2.title: Setting Tags
sect2.para: Tagging is a method to assign one or more keywords to a project or package. Assigning it to more packages will lead to a collection that is rendered as a tag cloud in your home project. This is just a sorted list of all your tags weighted by font size. The higher the font size the more packages contain this keyword.
To tag your project or a package proceed as follows:

step.para: Login in at with your favorite browser.
If you want to assign keywords to your repository, go to your home project and use Tags.
If you want to assign keywords to a package, click on the respective package and assign your keywords with Tags too.

sect2.para: If you need to edit more tags than one package, there is an easier method. Go to your home project and click Edit Tag Data under the tag cloud. It will open a new page where you can see all your packages. With the pencil icon on each line you can edit your tag data.

sect2.title: Adding Additional Maintainers
sect2.para: After you have created a package you are the only person which have permissions to modify it. If you want to give other developers also the right to change anything in your project, proceed as follows:

step.para: Login in at with your favorite browser.
Click the plus sign after the label Involved Users.
Insert the user id in the text field and proceed with Save changes.
step.remark: TODO: Explain role. At the moment you can only select 'maintainer' and nothing more.

sect2.title: Rating Repositories and Packages
sect2.para: If you like someone's repository or package you can give him credit points. You can give up to 5 stars. To rate proceed as follows:

step.para: Login in at with your favorite browser.
Go to the respective repository of the user you want to rate.
For a repository you just click on one of the stars after the repository name
For a package you must click on the package. You can rate it by clicking on one of the stars after the package name.

sect2.title: Monitoring your Build Status
sect2.para: If you need an overview of the status of all packages in your repository, proceed as follows:

step.para: Login in at with your favorite browser.
Click on Monitor Build Status . You can find it if you scroll down a bit after your build repositories on the right side.

sect2.para: You will notice the following status keywords:

listitem.para: Everything is fine, your package is correctly build and ready to download.
Somewhere an error occured. Probably there is a syntax error or similar mistakes in your SPEC file.
Your package depends on another package but nothing provides it.

sect2.para: You can also investigate the build status of a single package.

sect2.title: Informing about Statistics
sect2.para: For the mathematical interested user the &obs; can provide you with statistical information. From the main page click on Statistics and you will get an overview of the most active or most downloaded package.
